trans-unit.source: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight using Azure portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service. Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to administer HDInsight Service. Create an HDInsight cluster, open the interactive JavaScript console, and open the Hadoop command console.

trans-unit.source: Using the <linkText>Azure preview portal[preview-portal]</linkText><title></title>, you can provision and manage Linux-based Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Using the <linkText>Azure preview portal[preview-portal]</linkText><title></title>, you can provision and manage Linux-based Hadoop clusters in Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this document are specific to working with Linux-based Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this document are specific to working with Linux-based Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: For information on working with Windows-based clusters, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information on working with Windows-based clusters, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: There are also other tools available for administering HDInsight in addition to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: There are also other tools available for administering HDInsight in addition to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>: The Azure CLI is a cross-platform command line tool that allows you to manage Azure services
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>: The Azure CLI is a cross-platform command line tool that allows you to manage Azure services

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>: Azure PowerShell provides PowerShell cmdlets for managing Azure services
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>: Azure PowerShell provides PowerShell cmdlets for managing Azure services

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this article, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You can provision HDInsight clusters from the Azure portal by using the following steps:
trans-unit.target: You can provision HDInsight clusters from the Azure portal by using the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal[preview-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure Preview Portal[preview-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Select NEW, select Data Analytics, and then select HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Select NEW, select Data Analytics, and then select HDInsight

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating a new cluster in the Azure Preview Portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a Cluster Name, then select the Cluster Type you wish to create.
trans-unit.target: Enter a Cluster Name, then select the Cluster Type you wish to create.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear beside the Cluster Name if it is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear beside the Cluster Name if it is available.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster name, cluster type, and OS Type</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster name, cluster type, and OS Type</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Only the Hadoop cluster type is available for the Linux-based HDInsight preview.
trans-unit.target: Only the Hadoop cluster type is available for the Linux-based HDInsight preview.

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one subscription, select the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one subscription, select the Subscription entry to select the Azure subscription that will be used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For Resource Group, you can select the entry to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.
trans-unit.target: For Resource Group, you can select the entry to see a list of existing resource groups and then select the one to create the cluster in.

trans-unit.source: Or you can select Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Or you can select Create New and then enter the name of the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear to indicate if the new group name is available.

trans-unit.source: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.
trans-unit.target: This entry will default to one of your existing resource groups, if any are available.

trans-unit.source: Select Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Password for the Cluster Login Username.
trans-unit.target: Select Credentials, then enter a Cluster Login Password for the Cluster Login Username.

trans-unit.source: You must also enter an SSH Username and either a PASSWORD or PUBLIC KEY, which will be used to authenticate the SSH user.
trans-unit.target: You must also enter an SSH Username and either a PASSWORD or PUBLIC KEY, which will be used to authenticate the SSH user.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use the Select button to set the credentials.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use the Select button to set the credentials.

trans-unit.source: Remote desktop will not be used in this document, so you can leave it disabled.
trans-unit.target: Remote desktop will not be used in this document, so you can leave it disabled.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster credentials blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster credentials blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see one of the following articles:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see one of the following articles:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For Data Source, you can select the entry to choose an existing data source, or create a new one.
trans-unit.target: For Data Source, you can select the entry to choose an existing data source, or create a new one.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Data source blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Currently you can select an Azure Storage Account as the data source for an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the entries on the Data Source blade.

trans-unit.source: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts on your subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: Selection Method: Set this to From all subscriptions to enable browsing of storage accounts on your subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Set to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.
trans-unit.target: Set to Access Key if you want to enter the Storage Name and Access Key of an existing storage account.

trans-unit.source: Create New: Use this to create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Create New: Use this to create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the field that appears to enter the name of the storage account.

trans-unit.source: A green check will appear if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: A green check will appear if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Choose Default Container: Use this to enter the name of the default container to use for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.
trans-unit.target: While you can enter any name here, we recommend using the same name as the cluster so that you can easily recognize that the container is used for this specific cluster.

trans-unit.source: Location: The geographic region that the storage account will be is in, or will be created in.
trans-unit.target: Location: The geographic region that the storage account will be is in, or will be created in.

trans-unit.source: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Selecting the location for the default data source will also set the location of the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.
trans-unit.target: The cluster and default data source must be located in the same region.

trans-unit.source: Select: Use this to save the data source configuration.
trans-unit.target: Select: Use this to save the data source configuration.

trans-unit.source: Select Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Select Node Pricing Tiers to display information about the nodes that will be created for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: By default, the number of worker nodes will be set to 4.
trans-unit.target: By default, the number of worker nodes will be set to 4.

trans-unit.source: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown at the bottom of this blade.
trans-unit.target: The estimated cost of the cluster will be shown at the bottom of this blade.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Node pricing tiers blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the Select button to save the Node Pricing Tiers information.
trans-unit.target: Use the Select button to save the Node Pricing Tiers information.

trans-unit.source: Select Optional Configuration.
trans-unit.target: Select Optional Configuration.

trans-unit.source: This blade allows you to configure the following items:
trans-unit.target: This blade allows you to configure the following items:

trans-unit.source: HDInsight Version: The version of HDInsight used for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight Version: The version of HDInsight used for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information on HDInsight versioning, see <linkText>HDInsight component versioning</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information on HDInsight versioning, see <linkText>HDInsight component versioning</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: External Metastores: This allows you to select a SQL Database, which will be used to store configuration information for Oozie and Hive.
trans-unit.target: External Metastores: This allows you to select a SQL Database, which will be used to store configuration information for Oozie and Hive.

trans-unit.source: This allows you to reuse the configuration when deleting and recreating a cluster, instead of having to recreate the Hive and Oozie configuration each time.
trans-unit.target: This allows you to reuse the configuration when deleting and recreating a cluster, instead of having to recreate the Hive and Oozie configuration each time.

trans-unit.source: *Azure Storage Keys: This allows you to associate additional storage accounts with the HDInsight server.
trans-unit.target: *Azure Storage Keys: This allows you to associate additional storage accounts with the HDInsight server.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight can only access Azure Storage accounts used as the default data store, added through this configuration section, or that are publicly accessible.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight can only access Azure Storage accounts used as the default data store, added through this configuration section, or that are publicly accessible.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Optional configuration blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Optional configuration blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then select Create.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that Pin to Startboard is selected, and then select Create.

trans-unit.source: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.
trans-unit.target: This will create the cluster and add a tile for it to the Startboard of your Azure Portal.

trans-unit.source: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.
trans-unit.target: The icon will indicate that the cluster is provisioning, and will change to display the HDInsight icon once provisioning has completed.

trans-unit.source: | While provisioning | Provisioning complete | | ------------------ | --------------------- | | <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText> | <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText> |
trans-unit.target: | While provisioning | Provisioning complete | | ------------------ | --------------------- | | <linkText>Provisioning indicator on startboard</linkText> | <linkText>Provisioned cluster tile</linkText> |

trans-unit.source: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: It will take some time for the cluster to be created, usually around 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.
trans-unit.target: Use the tile on the Startboard, or the Notifications entry on the left of the page to check on the provisioning process.

trans-unit.source: Selecting a cluster from the Azure preview portal will display essential information about the cluster, such as the name, resource group, operating system, and the URL for the cluster dashboard (used to access Ambari Web for Linux clusters.)
trans-unit.target: Selecting a cluster from the Azure preview portal will display essential information about the cluster, such as the name, resource group, operating system, and the URL for the cluster dashboard (used to access Ambari Web for Linux clusters.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Cluster details</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Cluster details</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the Essentials and Quick Links section:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to understand the icons at the top of this blade, and in the Essentials and Quick Links section:

trans-unit.source: Settings and All Settings: Displays the Settings blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Settings and All Settings: Displays the Settings blade for the cluster, which allows you to access detailed configuration information for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Dashboard, Cluster Dashboard, and URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is Ambari Web for Linux-based clusters.
trans-unit.target: Dashboard, Cluster Dashboard, and URL: These are all ways to access the cluster dashboard, which is Ambari Web for Linux-based clusters.

trans-unit.source: Secure Shell: Information needed to access the cluster using SSH.
trans-unit.target: Secure Shell: Information needed to access the cluster using SSH.

trans-unit.source: Scale Cluster: Allows you to change the number of worker nodes for this cluster.
trans-unit.target: Scale Cluster: Allows you to change the number of worker nodes for this cluster.

trans-unit.source: Delete: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Delete: Deletes the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: __Quickstart (<linkText>cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart</linkText>)__: Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: __Quickstart (<linkText>cloud and thunderbolt icon = quickstart</linkText>)__: Displays information that will help you get started using HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: __Users (users icon)_: Allows you to set permissions for _portal management of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: __Users (users icon)_: Allows you to set permissions for _portal management of this cluster for other users on your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: This only affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This only affects access and permissions to this cluster in the Azure preview portal, and has no effect on who can connect to or submit jobs to the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: __Tags (<linkText>tag icon</linkText>)__: Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.
trans-unit.target: __Tags (<linkText>tag icon</linkText>)__: Tags allows you to set key/value pairs to define a custom taxonomy of your cloud services.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may create a key named project, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may create a key named project, and then use a common value for all services associated with a specific project.

trans-unit.source: Documentation: Links to documentation for Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Documentation: Links to documentation for Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: To manage the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.
trans-unit.target: To manage the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Ambari, see <linkText>Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Ambari, see <linkText>Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Usage section of the HDInsight cluster blade dislays information about the number of cores available to your subscription for use with HDInsight, as well as the number of cores allocated to this cluster and how they are allocated for the nodes within this cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Usage section of the HDInsight cluster blade dislays information about the number of cores available to your subscription for use with HDInsight, as well as the number of cores allocated to this cluster and how they are allocated for the nodes within this cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Usage information</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Usage information</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To monitor the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.
trans-unit.target: To monitor the services provided by the HDInsight cluster, you must use Ambari Web or the Ambari REST API.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using Ambari, see <linkText>Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information on using Ambari, see <linkText>Manage HDInsight clusters using Ambari</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: In this article, you have learned how to create an HDInsight cluster by using the Azure portal, and how to open the Hadoop command-line tool.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you have learned how to create an HDInsight cluster by using the Azure portal, and how to open the Hadoop command-line tool.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see the following articles:
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see the following articles:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administer HDInsight Using Azure CLI</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provision HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Submit Hadoop jobs programmatically</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get Started with Azure HDInsight</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get Started with Azure HDInsight</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>What version of Hadoop is in Azure HDInsight?</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: https://portal.azure.com
trans-unit.target: https://portal.azure.com
